message_list.content: Hello, this is Ashley, a virtual smile assistant from ClearChoice Dental Implant Centers. Thank you for calling. Who am I speaking with today?
My name is Elizabeth.

Hi Elizabeth—it's wonderful to meet you. I’m here to help you every step of the way. Can you tell me a little about what brings you to ClearChoice today? Are you interested in a consultation for dental implants or dentures?
Yeah, I think I want implants. I saw that you guys have, like, teeth in a day, so I think I need to get that done.

Thank you for sharing that, Elizabeth. Many people are interested in the “teeth in a day” approach, and I can help you understand what to expect and see if you’re a good fit for a consultation. To get started, could you tell me a bit about your dental situation? For example, are you missing any teeth, do you have teeth that are failing or broken beyond repair, or have you been told you have gum disease? Just share what feels most accurate for you.

Yeah, I have a few missing teeth from an accident when I was little, and I've been wearing, like, a bridge. But it just doesn't look good, and it's not fitting good. And I think—well, I saw the commercial, and I think I need implants instead. I just need my teeth fixed.

Thank you for opening up about your experience, Elizabeth. That sounds really tough, and it’s completely understandable to want a lasting solution that feels and looks right for you. You mentioned you have a few missing teeth and are currently wearing a bridge that isn’t fitting well. That helps me understand your situation. Just to be thorough, have you ever had a denture or partial denture, or any dental implants before? Or is the bridge the only solution you’ve tried so far?

No, I've just had the bridge, but, you know, I have had a dentist tell me before that, like, I'm gonna need, you know, a denture when I'm older, and I just don't want that. I'd rather something that looks really good. I'm kind of embarrassed by my smile.

Elizabeth, thank you for sharing that with me. It’s completely normal to feel self-conscious, and you’re definitely not alone—many people feel the same way before taking this step. The good news is, you’re in the right place to explore options that can help you feel confident about your smile again. Before we move forward, are you experiencing any dental pain right now? If so, I’d like to understand how much discomfort you’re in.
No, I'm not in any pain, but I'm more so wanting to know where you guys are located, and I'm wondering how close you are. Where would I go?

Absolutely, Elizabeth—I can help you find the closest ClearChoice center so you know exactly where you’d go for your consultation. So I can look up the nearest location, may I have your full address, including your street, city, state, and zip code? This will help me find the most convenient center for you.
Yeah. It's 123—oh, I'm sorry, it's 12042 South 75th Avenue. And that's Palos Heights 60463.
Thank you, Elizabeth. I have your address as 12042 South Seventy-Fifth Avenue, Palos Heights, Illinois, 60463. Is that correct? And just to make sure I have everything I need.
That's right.

Perfect, thank you for confirming that, Elizabeth. Just a couple more quick questions so I can get everything set up for you: Could you please share your date of birth? This helps us keep your information secure and ensures we match you with the right care team.
Yeah. My birthday is 10/22/1959.

Thank you, Elizabeth. I have your date of birth as October twenty-second, nineteen fifty-nine. Next, may I have the best phone number to reach you? This will be used for appointment reminders and to confirm your consultation.
Thank you. Just to confirm, I have your phone number as 708-288-5348. Is that correct?
That's right. I have a question. I, I suspect that this treatment is really expensive. Do you know how much it costs?

Elizabeth, that’s a great question, and it’s completely understandable to want to know about costs before moving forward. While I don’t have exact pricing since every treatment plan is unique and depends on your specific needs, I can share some helpful information. ClearChoice offers a free consultation where you’ll meet with the doctor and care team to get a personalized treatment plan and a clear understanding of costs—there are no surprises. We also have a special Insurance Assurance Program: if you have dental or health insurance, you could qualify for up to five thousand dollars off your double fixed arch treatment, which is up to two thousand five hundred dollars off per arch. All you need to do is bring your insurance card to your consultation and mention the “Insurance Assurance” Program. If you’d like, I can also explain our financing options and what to expect at your first visit. Would you like to hear more about that?
Yeah, I have insurance. I just didn't think it covers much for implants. So, yeah, I wanna figure out how I'm gonna pay for this.

Thank you for sharing that, Elizabeth. Many people feel the same way about insurance and dental implants, so you’re not alone. Even though most insurance plans don’t cover the full cost of implants, with our Insurance Assurance Program, you could still qualify for up to five thousand dollars off your double fixed arch treatment—just by bringing your insurance card to your consultation and mentioning the program. As for payment, ClearChoice offers several health care financing options to help make treatment more affordable. Most patients who qualify for financing have a credit score of 650 or higher, but if your score is lower, you can apply with a co-signer. You’ll get all the details and a personalized plan at your free consultation, so you’ll know exactly what to expect before making any decisions. Does that help answer your questions about cost and payment? And are you interested in learning more about financing, or do you think you’ll be using insurance and self-pay?

No. I think—well, I don't know. I think that's fine for now. I guess what I'm trying to decide is, like, my dentist might be able to do implants, but your commercial just looks so good. So I don't know if I should—I have an appointment coming up with my dentist, and I'm just wondering if I should go there and see if they can do the work because I know they're right here in my neighborhood.

Elizabeth, I completely understand where you’re coming from. It’s a big decision, and it’s perfectly normal to want to explore all your options—especially when it comes to something as important as your smile. What makes ClearChoice unique is that everything happens under one roof: you’ll meet with your doctor, the clinical team, and your treatment coordinator all in the same location, and you’ll get a clear, all-inclusive cost with no surprises. The consultation is completely free, and there’s no obligation—so you can come in, get a personalized treatment plan, and then decide what feels right for you. Many people find it helpful to compare options before making a final decision. If you’d like, we can schedule your free consultation so you have all the information you need to make the best choice for yourself. There’s absolutely no pressure—this is just about giving you clarity and confidence. Would you like to go ahead and see what appointment times are available?

Yeah. I probably should just come in because, yeah, I'm gonna have to see what your doctors can do and, like, what my doctor is gonna be able to do. You know what, I have to head into work right now, though, so I'll give you guys a callback. What are your, are you guys open Monday through Friday?

Absolutely, Elizabeth—I understand you need to get to work. Most ClearChoice centers are open Monday through Friday, and some locations may also offer limited Saturday hours. When you’re ready, just give us a call back, and we’ll be here to help you schedule your free consultation and answer any other questions you might have. Thank you so much for sharing your story with me today. I hope you have a wonderful day at work.
